text: Beef Bulgogi (Korean BBQ Beef)
label: title

text: Ingredients
label: header

text: 2 pounds top sirloin or ribeye (907g)
label: ingredient

text: ½ cup low-sodium soy sauce or tamari (118ml)
label: ingredient

text: 2 tablespoons brown sugar
label: ingredient

text: 2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar
label: ingredient

text: 1 tablespoon sesame oil
label: ingredient

text: 3 tablespoons honey
label: ingredient

text: 1 teaspoon ground black pepper
label: ingredient

text: ¾ teaspoon gochugaru (Korean chili powder)
label: ingredient

text: 4 cloves garlic, smashed
label: ingredient

text: 1 ½ inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and roughly chopped into ¼ inch pieces
label: ingredient

text: 1 Asian pear, peeled, cored, and cut into 1-inch pieces
label: ingredient

text: 1 bunch green onions, trimmed and thinly sliced
label: ingredient

text: 1 tablespoon sesame seeds
label: ingredient

text: 3 tablespoons high-heat cooking oil, like avocado oil
label: ingredient

text: Lettuce leaves, steamed rice, kimchi, and ssamjang (Korean dipping sauce), optional for serving
label: ingredient

text: Instructions
label: header

text: Partially freeze the beef: Place the beef in the freezer for 20 to 30 minutes to firm up. This makes thinly slicing it much easier. Do not leave it much longer, or it will become too hard to slice safely.
label: step

text: Make the marinade: While the beef chills, prepare the marinade. Add the soy sauce, brown sugar, rice wine vinegar, sesame oil, honey, black pepper, gochugaru, smashed garlic cloves, roughly chopped ginger, and chopped pear to the bowl of a food processor. Pulse until you no longer see large bits of garlic, ginger, or pear.
label: step

text: Slice the beef: Remove the beef from the freezer and thinly slice across the grain, no more than ¼ inch thick. If some are thinner or more scraggly, it is fine.
label: step

text: Marinate: Add the sliced beef to a nonreactive bowl (glass or stainless steel) and pour the marinade over it. Toss well, then press a sheet of plastic wrap or parchment paper directly onto the meat to prevent oxidation. Cover the bowl with foil or more plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 4 hours and up to overnight.
label: step

text: Cook: Heat a wide, heavy-bottomed skillet over medium-high heat with a tablespoon of oil. Working in batches, lift the beef from the marinade, shaking off any excess liquid, and place it in the pan in a single layer. Sear without moving for 1 to 2 minutes, then flip and cook until caramelized and charred around the edges. Transfer to a plate and repeat with the remaining beef.
label: step

text: To finish: Once all the beef is cooked, return it all to the pan. Add the green onions and sesame seeds, tossing for about 30 seconds until the onions just begin to wilt. Serve immediately.
label: step
